Package eg

Class Formatter

java.lang.Object
eg.Formatter
public class Formatter
extends java.lang.Object
The formatting of EditArea objects. The properties 'Wordwrap', 'Font' and 'Font size' are initially read from Prefs.
See Also:
EditArea

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Formatter​(int number, java.lang.String keyPrefix)
    Creates a Formatter for a given number of EditArea objects.

  • Constructor Details

    • Formatter

      public Formatter​(int number, java.lang.String keyPrefix)
      Creates a Formatter for a given number of EditArea objects. Only if number is equal to 1 a formatted EditArea is created and accessed through editArea(). If number is minimum 2 an initially empty array of EditArea objects is created.
      Parameters:
      number - the number of EditArea objects
      keyPrefix - A prefix for the keys for the format properties set in Prefs. Can be the empty string

  • Method Details

    • editArea

      public EditArea editArea()
      Gets this single formatted EditArea
      Returns:
      this EditArea

    • editAreaArray

      public EditArea[] editAreaArray()
      Gets this EditArea array
      Returns:
      this EditArea array

    • createEditAreaAt

      public void createEditAreaAt​(int i)
      Assigns a new formatted EditArea to this EditArea array at the specified position
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the array element

    • setIndex

      public void setIndex​(int i)
      Selects the element in this EditArea array in which the wordwrap state may be changed.
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the array element

    • openSetFontDialog

      public void openSetFontDialog()
      Makes the dialog for setting the font and font size visible

    • enableWordWrap

      public void enableWordWrap​(boolean wordwrap)
      Sets the boolean that specifies if wordwrap is enabled. Enabling wordwrap also hides line numbers whereas disabling wordwrap shows line numbers if the corresponding boolean is set to true in showLineNumbers(boolean).

      The wordwrap state is changed only in the element specified in setIndex(int)

      Parameters:
      wordwrap - true to enable, false to disable

    • showLineNumbers

      public void showLineNumbers​(boolean b)
      Sets the boolean that specifies if line numbers are shown.

      Line numbers are not shown in EditArea objects in which wordwrap is enabled.

      Parameters:
      b - true to show, false to hide line numbers

    • setProperties

      public void setProperties()
      Sets the current values for the properties wordwrap, font and font size in Prefs
